story.title: The Story Behind
story.paragraph1: Marie Lou was my grandmother. She loved nothing more than an afternoon coffee with the people she cared about — making sure everyone felt welcome, comfortable, and loved.
story.paragraph2: As a child, my job was to brew the coffee in her old French press. I didn't know it then, but those afternoons shaped everything.
story.paragraph3: When she passed away while I was traveling through coffee-growing regions of Africa and Asia, I made a promise: to honor her by caring for others the way she did.
story.paragraph4: Marie Lou Coffee is that promise — exceptional coffee that puts farmers first, transparency above profit, and love into every cup.

storyPage.title: For You, Grandma
storyPage.subtitle: The story of Marie Lou Coffee — a promise made, a mission born.
storyPage.imageAlt: Marcel, founder of Marie Lou Coffee

intro.title: An Afternoon with Marie Lou
intro.p1: My grandmother's name was Maria Louise, but everyone called her Marie Lou.
intro.p2: Every afternoon, without exception, she invited someone over for coffee. A neighbor. A friend. Sometimes a stranger who just needed someone to talk to. Her kitchen table was where people came to feel welcome, to feel heard, to feel loved.
intro.p3: As a small child, I was given an important job: brewing the coffee. I'd carefully measure the grounds into her old French press, pour the hot water, and wait — watching the dark liquid slowly steep. Those afternoons taught me something that would shape my entire life.

world.title: The World Beyond
world.p1: Years later, I traveled the world with my girlfriend. We visited coffee and tea growing regions in Africa and Asia — Ethiopia, Kenya, Indonesia, Vietnam.
world.p2: We met farmers who worked from sunrise to sunset, picking coffee cherries by hand in the heat. Families living in conditions we couldn't have imagined. Children whose futures were largely determined by where they happened to be born.
world.p3: We saw the disconnect: the coffee I was paying €15 for in Munich came from people earning a fraction of that price. The supply chain was designed to extract value at every step. I couldn't stop thinking: how is this okay?

promise.title: A Promise Made
promise.p1: While we were traveling, I received the call that changed everything. Marie Lou had passed away.
promise.p2: Sitting in a small guesthouse thousands of miles from home, I thought about her kitchen table. About all those afternoons. About how she spent her life making sure the people around her felt cared for.
promise.quote: I made a promise: to find a way to care for people the way she did — not just the people I could see, but the ones growing the coffee I love.

innovation.title: A Different Kind of Coffee Company

roasters.title: Built My Own Roasters
roasters.description: Using sensors, microcontrollers, and machine learning, I designed low-cost roasters that produce consistently perfect results. They run on renewable electricity and cost a fraction of commercial equipment.

direct.title: Eliminated the Middlemen
direct.description: I buy directly from farmers I've personally visited. No importers. No commodity markets. Direct relationships based on trust and fair prices.

noMarketing.title: No Marketing Waste
noMarketing.description: No expensive packaging. No celebrity endorsements. No social media ad campaigns. Just good coffee and honest communication.

fairPay.title: Fair, Not Excessive
fairPay.description: I'm not trying to build a unicorn startup. I'm trying to make great coffee that helps real people. All of this means more money goes to the farmers.

closing.title: This One's For You, Oma
closing.p1: My grandmother never met the farmers who grow Marie Lou Coffee. But I think she would have loved them. I think she would have invited them to her kitchen table, poured them a cup, and made them feel like the most important people in the world.
closing.p2: We all need more happiness in our lives. More connection. More moments where we feel like someone cares. So when you're drinking your coffee tomorrow morning, I hope you think about Marie Lou.

ordering.title: Ordering & Payment
ordering.q1: How do I place an order?
ordering.a1: Simply browse our shop, select your favorite coffee and grind type, add it to your cart, and proceed to checkout. We accept all major credit cards, SEPA direct debit, and Klarna.
ordering.q2: When will my coffee be roasted?
ordering.a2: We roast your coffee within 24 hours of receiving your order. We never pre-roast or stock coffee — every bag is made fresh just for you.
ordering.q3: Can I modify or cancel my order?
ordering.a3: If your order hasn't been roasted yet, we can usually make changes. Please contact us as soon as possible at hello@marieloucoffee.com.

shipping.title: Shipping & Delivery
shipping.a1: Standard shipping within Germany takes 2-4 business days. EU shipping typically takes 3-7 business days. Your coffee is shipped the day after roasting.
shipping.a2: Shipping within Germany is €4.95, free on orders over €49. EU shipping is €9.95, free on orders over €75. Switzerland shipping is €14.95.
shipping.a3: We currently ship to Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Netherlands, Belgium, France, Italy, Spain, Poland, Czech Republic, Denmark, and Sweden.

coffee.title: About Our Coffee
coffee.a1: Very fresh! We roast your coffee specifically for your order and ship it the next day. You'll typically receive it within 3-5 days of roasting — at peak freshness.
coffee.q2: What grind options do you offer?
coffee.a2: We offer whole bean, filter grind, espresso grind, French press grind, and moka pot grind. If you're unsure, whole bean is always the freshest option.
coffee.q3: How should I store my coffee?
coffee.a3: Keep your coffee in an airtight container at room temperature, away from light and moisture. Don't refrigerate or freeze it. Best consumed within 4-6 weeks of roasting.

returns.title: Returns & Refunds
returns.q1: What if I don't like my coffee?
returns.a1: We want you to love your coffee! If you're not satisfied, contact us within 14 days and we'll make it right — whether that's a replacement, store credit, or refund.
returns.q2: Can I return an opened bag?
returns.a2: Yes! If the taste isn't what you expected, we'll still work with you. We believe in our coffee and want every customer to be happy.
